transcription_sentences.speaker: sales_rep
transcription_sentences.text: Hi, is this Zhi? Hi, this is Arjun calling from MongoDB. Do you have a minute?

transcription_sentences.speaker: prospect
transcription_sentences.text: Um, yeah, this is Zhi. Go ahead.

transcription_sentences.speaker: sales_rep
transcription_sentences.text: Great, thank you. I understand you’re the CFO at Acme Corp., right? I’ll keep this brief—just wanted to check if you’re the right person to talk to about your database infrastructure?

transcription_sentences.speaker: prospect
transcription_sentences.text: Yeah, that’s me. What’s this about?

transcription_sentences.speaker: sales_rep
transcription_sentences.text: Sure—uh, I saw Acme’s been on on-prem MongoDB for a while. We’re working with adtech companies looking to optimize cloud costs, especially with recent pushes. Are you exploring ways to lower your DB overhead?

transcription_sentences.speaker: prospect
transcription_sentences.text: We are. But we just invested a lot in our on-prem setup. Cloud sounds great but isn’t it expensive long term?

transcription_sentences.speaker: sales_rep
transcription_sentences.text: Honestly, it can be if you’re not careful. But with Atlas, you only pay for the resources you use—plus, savings from reduced admin costs and built-in automation usually offset those variable fees. May I ask—are you seeing high maintenance costs internally?

transcription_sentences.speaker: prospect
transcription_sentences.text: Yeah, honestly, our team spends a lot of cycles on backups, patching, all of that. But migration sounds risky.

transcription_sentences.speaker: sales_rep
transcription_sentences.text: Totally get that. Migrations are scary. But since you’re already on MongoDB, the move to Atlas is usually pretty smooth—we have white-glove migration services and no app-level rewrites needed. Out of curiosity, how big is your data set?

transcription_sentences.speaker: prospect
transcription_sentences.text: We’re at about 12 terabytes. So… downtime is a concern. Can you guarantee zero downtime?

transcription_sentences.speaker: sales_rep
transcription_sentences.text: With our live migration tooling, we can keep downtime to minutes, and we schedule everything around your low-traffic windows. It’s not completely zero, but it’s very close—would your CTO want to hear more?

transcription_sentences.speaker: prospect
transcription_sentences.text: Maybe, but another thing. We’re worried about getting locked in—if down the road Atlas isn’t right, are we stuck?

transcription_sentences.speaker: sales_rep
transcription_sentences.text: That’s a fair point. Since Atlas uses open MongoDB APIs and compatible binaries, you can always export your data if you ever want to move. There’s no proprietary data format. Does that address your concern at all?

transcription_sentences.speaker: prospect
transcription_sentences.text: Somewhat. Compliance is also a question—can you meet EU privacy requirements?

transcription_sentences.speaker: sales_rep
transcription_sentences.text: Yep—Atlas is certified for SOC2, GDPR, and more. Data residency controls let you keep data in the EU if you need. I can send over details.

transcription_sentences.speaker: prospect
transcription_sentences.text: Okay. This is more relevant now, given the pressure on cost and compliance. Can you email me some case studies?

transcription_sentences.speaker: sales_rep
transcription_sentences.text: Absolutely. And maybe set up a quick call with your tech lead? I’ll keep it short—just show what the migration could look like.

transcription_sentences.speaker: prospect
transcription_sentences.text: Sure, send me an invite and I’ll loop in our CTO.

transcription_sentences.speaker: sales_rep
transcription_sentences.text: Thanks, Zhi. I’ll follow up right away. Appreciate your time.

transcription_sentences.speaker: prospect
transcription_sentences.text: Thank you, Arjun.
